isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - INSTRUMENTS (New Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - TROUBLESHOOTING (INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHT DIAGNOSTICS) - BRAKE PRESSURE

entry.para: Disconnect hydraulic brake booster monitor module (49) and use a test jumper to connect pin C/circuit 90T to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (49), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, replace brake monitor module.
Loosen cluster and remove brake pressure light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at connector (49), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 90T to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90T, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28A from fuse F6, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (49), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (49).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
Remove warning buzzer at relay socket (R1), move key switch to ignition position, and at relay socket and circuit 40, connect a jumper to ground. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Re-install warning buzzer. To test sensor circuits, go to Step 6.
Loosen cluster and remove brake pressure warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and re-install warning buzzer.
Disconnect connector (26), and with jumper still attached at socket (R1), measure resistance from connector (26) circuit 40 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 40, then repair.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (26) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28A from fuse F6, then repair.
With jumper still installed at socket (R1), reconnect connector (26). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Re-install warning buzzer. To test sensor circuits, go to next step.
Replace defective cluster assembly. Re-install warning buzzer.
Disconnect low air press. sensor connector and install a jumper wire from circuit 40 to ground. Does warning light illuminate?
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 40B or 40A, connector (2), or circuit 40, then repair. Go to next step.
Remove jumper and reconnect air pressure sensor connector. Drain air pressure from brake system until <60 psi. Does warning light illuminate?
Circuits check good. Turn key switch off.
Disconnect hydraulic brake booster monitor module connector (86) and use a test jumper to connect pin C/circuit 90M to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (86), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, replace brake monitor module.
Loosen cluster and remove brake pressure light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (10), and with jumper still attached at connector (86), measure resistance from connector (10) circuit 90N to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90N or 90M, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (10) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28A from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (86), reconnect connector (10). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (86).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
Disconnect air pressure switch connector (717) and use a test jumper to connect circuit 40 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect conn. (717), and drain air from brake system. If warning light does not illuminate when press. <60 psi, replace pressure switch.
Loosen cluster and remove brake pressure light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (10), and with jumper still attached at connector (717), measure resistance from connector (10) circuit 40A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 40A or 40, connector (2), or circuit 40, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (10) circuit 28A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28A from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (717), reconnect connector (10). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (717).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
Disconnect hydraulic brake booster monitor module connector (86) and use a test jumper to connect pin C/circuit 90M to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (86), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, replace brake monitor module.
Loosen cluster and remove brake pressure light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (12), and with jumper still attached at connector (86), measure resistance from connector (12) circuit 90N to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90N or 90M, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (12) circuit 28D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28D from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (86), reconnect connector (12). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (86).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
Disconnect air pressure switch connector (1LA) and use a test jumper to connect circuit 40 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect conn. (1LA), and drain air from brake system. If warning light does not illuminate when press. <60 psi, replace pressure switch.
Loosen cluster and remove brake pressure light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (12), and with jumper still attached at connector (1LA), measure resistance from connector (12) circuit 40A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 40A or 40, conn. (2), circuit 40, connector (196), or circuit 40, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (12) circuit 28D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 28 or 28D from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (1LA), reconnect connector (12). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (1LA).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
